result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon A. Keller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 fine plus costs, including buy money and Court-appointed Attorney fees upon Court's approval of attorney fee bill. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 2 years if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon A. Keller

records.addlTxt: for 3 years to pay Court-ordered financial obligations
and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
of Conviction

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting furlough for oral surgery. Per Court, approved. May be released 8/1. Return 8/4. Maintain absolute sobriety other than prescription medications.
for Sentence Modification - Defendant requesting 37 days credit. Per Court, denied. It was my intent to impose 6 months of conditional jail time to begin on the date of the hearing, 3/13/17.
6 months conditional jail time and Huber privileges
Door County Jail

Defendant Devon A. Keller appeared by video conference. Colleen Catherine Nordin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Olivia Glesner appeared for DOC. Court reviews request from DOC regarding imposition of jail time, reviews statute, questions whether jail time can be imposed without a hearing. Discussion with Defendant/State/DOC re: procedure. Court signs AJC imposing 6 months of jail time, grants Huber.
from DOC requesting imposition of conditional jail time
Hearing on March 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Atty Bill

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devon A. Keller in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties. Discussion regarding second & subsequent, repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Devon A. Keller in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Defense requests that sentencing be set off for at least 3 weeks. Parties are not requesting PSI. Bond continues as is. Court addresses Defendant's failure to make monthly payments toward attorney fees.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Devon A. Keller in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty plea. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment at 03-09-2015 10:00 am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: State's Discovery Demand
Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge. Court approves request.
by Defendant
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. State will file and Information and State's Discovery Demand later today. Court reminds defendant of monthly court appointed atty fee payments. Bond remains in effect.

Defendant Devon A. Keller in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Johnson accepts court appointment. Defense waives reading of the complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees

Defendant Devon A. Keller in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant files remainder of form for court appointed attorney. Court appoints Atty Steve Johnson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $100 per month toward atty fees. First payment due by 3/15/15. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devon A. Keller in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant files Petition for Appointment of Counsel form for court to review. Defendant would like to contact a few attorneys before court appoints one. Court reschedules matter, encourages defendant to contact some attorneys and file paperwork with the court before next court appearance. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 11:45 am.
by Maynette Jutila
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Converted to cash bond.

Defendant Devon A. Keller in court, in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant advises he worked until 2:00 am and overslept, didn't wake up until 11:00 that morning. State asks court to amend bond to $750 cash bond with same conditions. Defendant gives argument on bond. Court makes statement, converts signature bond to $500 cash bond. Same conditions apply.
Defendant in custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Devon A. Keller not in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case at 8:06 am. No appearance by defendant at AIA. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Devon A. Keller in court, in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant didn't have time with his work schedule to look for an attorney. Defendant indicates he's being released from jail tomorrow, will have time then to look for an attorney. Court gives defendant time to retain an attorney or fill out form for court appointed attorney. If defendant wishes to go court appointed route, he's to fill out form and file it with the court before next court appearance. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 12/09/14 by jail staff.

To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Defendant Devon A. Keller in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant requests time to retain an attorney. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
